summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons memoranda detailing the events of July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with an orange cloth around his neck in an apparent suicide attempt. The reports include conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, and detail Epstein's subsequent allegations that Tartaglione tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the incident; found with an orange cloth around his neck in his cell, later alleges his cellmate tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who reported finding Epstein with a string around his neck; later accused by Epstein of attempted murder and extortion.

connections.description: Shared a cell in the Special Housing Unit; Epstein accused Tartaglione of attempted murder, harassment, and extortion.
Epstein stated he had informed his attorney about the alleged threats from his cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with an orange homemade rope/cloth around his neck, appearing unresponsive. Staff intervened, removed the material, and transported him to the HA-Unit for suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Alleges Murder Attempt and Extortion
events.description: After becoming responsive, Epstein told staff he believed his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, tried to kill him and had been attempting to extort money from him for a week, threatening violence.

events.title: Epstein's Legal Visit
events.description: Epstein stated he returned from a legal visit at approximately 8:00 PM on the evening before the incident.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (9-South), M Tier, Cell Z05-124
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at approximately 1:27 a.m. on July 23, 2019, with an orange homemade rope/cloth around his neck, in an incident documented as a possible suicide attempt.

Epstein later alleged that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been extorting him with threats of violence for about a week, claims he said he had only reported to his attorney.
Medical examination after the incident revealed a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of Epstein's neck with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee.
The incident reports contain discrepancies, including Tartaglione's changing account of his own actions and Epstein's claim that he only remembered waking up with staff present after getting water.
Epstein exhibited unpredictable behavior after the incident, including pretending to fall head-first off a bed and giving a thumbs-up after being warned.
